snippet: Leaders of the affected countries and the head of the World Health Organization introduced a $100 million plan to combat the disease that will allow hundreds of medical professionals to be deployed to West Africa.
abstract: Dr Margaret Chan, World Health Organization director general, warns that Ebola virus, as fatalities mount in West Africa, is moving faster than efforts to curb it, with potentially catastrophic consequences; leaders of affected countries and WHO introduce $100 million plan to combat the disease that will allow hundreds of medical professionals to be deployed to West Africa.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Abuja, and Alan Cowell from London. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome, Alan Blinder from Atlanta, and Denise Grady from New York.

lead_paragraph: Leaders of the affected countries and the head of the World Health Organization introduced a $100 million plan to combat the disease that will allow hundreds of medical professionals to be deployed to West Africa.

headline.main: Ebola Virus Is Outpacing Efforts to Control It, World Health Body Warns
headline.print_headline: Ebola Virus Is Outpacing Efforts to Control It, World Health Body Warns
